thread.title: Harrisburg's UpNext Fest will spotlight local technology industry - PennLive.com
thread.title_full: Harrisburg's UpNext Fest will spotlight local technology industry - PennLive.com

title: Harrisburg's UpNext Fest will spotlight local technology industry - PennLive.com
text:
Comments 
Entrepreneurs and tech geeks need not go to Silicon Valley to get startup fix: Harrisburg's UpNext Fest is designed just for them. 
The Oct. 10-17 event is a weeklong celebration of technology and businesses. The conference covers everything from the evolution of healthcare technology, explorations into robotics and tips for pitching your ideas to investors. 
The festival's events will be held at a wide variety of venues, from the Radisson Hotel and Convention Center (1150 Camp Hill Bypass, Camp Hill) to Midtown Cinema (250 Reily St., Harrisburg). 
Bar Camp is the first of the UpNext festival events, being held from 8 a.m. to 3 :30 p.m., this free event includes breakfast and lunch. It's a chance to learn more about web design, robotics and application development. It will be at Harrisburg Area Community College's midtown campus (1500 N. Third St., Harrisburg). 
Individual events at UpNext range from free (Bar Camp) to $50 (Healthcare Technology â€“ Outcomes 1.0). You can get a festival pass, which provides admission to all UpNext Festival events are $125 for non Technology Council of Central Pennsylvania members. 
For those looking for more of a networking opportunity (and less of a learning one), the conference offers those too. 
It's tech night over at Midtown Cinema on Oct. 13. Starting at 6 p.m., the theater will be screening three different tech-themed films: the Steve Jobs biopic "Jobs," artificial intelligence thriller "Ex Machina" and sci-fi romance "Her." Tickets for the film festival are $15. In between screenings you can grab a beer from Zero Day or check out one of the food trucks parked around the cinema. Admission includes one beverage from ZeroDay and popcorn. Complete list of movies playing in central Pa. this weekend 
Level 2 (215 N. Second St., Harrisburg) is being converted into the Tech Lounge on Oct. 15 from 6-9 p.m. Tickets are $25. This networking event will include hors d'oeuvres, live music and a semi-open bar. Fashionable dress is encouraged. 
Classic rock, blues and country music will be the soundtrack at FedLive at the Federal Taphouse (234 N. Second St., Harrisburg) on Oct. 16 for the UpNext music festival. There will be performances by 40Degrees North and Jon Pyle and the Black Syndicate. The $15 ticket includes two drink tickets and an assortment of pub food. 
UpNext concludes with Coder Kids, a free event focused on introducing kids to the concepts of science, technology, engineering and mathematics with hands-on learning projects. Held from noon to 2 p.m., Coder Kids event is held at HACC's midtown Harrisburg campus. 
For more information, a complete schedule of events and to buy tickets, go to upnextfest.com.
